subject: RE: [junit] [OT] Eclipse plugin
msgSnippet: I ve been looking into this myself to write a similar plugin. In 2.1.1, you can just go ALT+R,A,3 to run the current class as a Junit test. Kind Regards,

I've been looking into this myself to write a similar plugin.
In 2.1.1, you can just go ALT+R,A,3 to run the current class as a Junit
test.
Kind Regards,
Shaun.


> -----Original Message-----
> From: Jason Rogers [mailto:jacaetevha@...] 
> Sent: 30 July 2003 00:08
> To: JUnit
> Subject: [junit] [OT] Eclipse plugin
> 
> 
> I have been combing through Eclipse docs and configuration 
> files, etc. but to no avail.  Does anyone out there know how 
> to add a context menu item to an active editor or perspective 
> selection?  I would like to save myself the trouble of having 
> to open an editor on a class just to be able to run it as a 
> JUnit test.  Conceivably one can edit one of the millions :) 
> of XML configuration files to add a context menu entry on the 
> currently selected class.  Any help would be appreciated, 
> either the answer to the question or a pointer to a document 
> describing how to do it.
> 
> Thanks.
> =jason
